verses.verse: Why <S%H4100><s%> dost Thou stand <S%H5975><s%> afar <S%H7350><s%> off, O Lord <S%H3068><s%>? Why dost Thou hide <S%H5956><s%> [Thyself] in times <S%H6256><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%>?

In pride <S%H1346><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> hotly <S%H1814><s%> pursue <S%H1814><s%> the afflicted; <S%H6041><s%> Let them be caught <S%H8610><s%> in the plots <S%H4209><s%> which <S%H2098><s%> they have devised. <S%H2803><s%>

For the wicked <S%H7563><s%> boasts <S%H1984><s%> of his heart's desire, <S%H8378><s%> And the greedy <S%H1214><s%> man <S%H1214><s%> curses <S%H1288><s%> [and] spurns <S%H5006><s%> the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

The wicked, <S%H7563><s%> in the haughtiness <S%H1363><s%> of his countenance, <S%H639><s%> does not seek <S%H1875><s%> [Him.] All <S%H3605><s%> his thoughts <S%H4209><s%> are, "There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> God. <S%H430><s%>"

His ways <S%H1870><s%> prosper <S%H2342><s%> at all <S%H3605><s%> times; <S%H6256><s%> Thy judgments <S%H4941><s%> are on high, <S%H4791><s%> out of his sight; <S%H5048><s%> As for all <S%H3605><s%> his adversaries, <S%H6887><s%> he snorts <S%H6315><s%> at them.
He says <S%H559><s%> to himself, <S%H3820><s%> "I shall not be moved; <S%H4131><s%> Throughout all <S%H1755><s%> generations <S%H1755><s%> I shall not be in adversity. <S%H9563><s%>"

His mouth <S%H6310><s%> is full <S%H4390><s%> of curses <S%H423><s%> and deceit <S%H4820><s%> and oppression; <S%H8496><s%> Under <S%H8478><s%> his tongue <S%H3956><s%> is mischief <S%H5999><s%> and wickedness. <S%H205><s%>

He sits <S%H3427><s%> in the lurking <S%H3993><s%> places <S%H3993><s%> of the villages; <S%H9161><s%> In the hiding <S%H4565><s%> places <S%H4565><s%> he kills <S%H2026><s%> the innocent; <S%H9345><s%> His eyes <S%H5869><s%> stealthily <S%H6845><s%> watch <S%H6845><s%> for the unfortunate. <S%H2489><s%>

He lurks <S%H693><s%> in a hiding <S%H4565><s%> place <S%H4565><s%> as a lion <S%H9030><s%> in his lair; <S%H5520><s%> He lurks <S%H693><s%> to catch <S%H2414><s%> the afflicted; <S%H6041><s%> He catches <S%H2414><s%> the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> when he draws <S%H4900><s%> him into his net. <S%H7568><s%>
He crouches, <S%H1794><s%> he bows <S%H7817><s%> down, <S%H7817><s%> And the unfortunate <S%H2489><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> by his mighty <S%H6099><s%> ones. <S%H6099><s%>

He says <S%H559><s%> to himself, <S%H3820><s%> "God <S%H410><s%> has forgotten; <S%H7911><s%> He has hidden <S%H5641><s%> His face; <S%H6440><s%> He will never <S%H1077><s%> <S%H5331><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> it."
Arise, <S%H6965><s%> O Lord; <S%H3068><s%> O God, <S%H410><s%> lift <S%H5375><s%> up Thy hand. <S%H3027><s%> Do not forget <S%H7911><s%> the afflicted. <S%H6035><s%>
Why <S%H5921><s%> <S%H4100><s%> has the wicked <S%H7563><s%> spurned <S%H5006><s%> God <S%H430><s%>? He has said <S%H559><s%> to himself, <S%H3820><s%> "Thou wilt not require <S%H1875><s%> [it]."

Thou hast seen <S%H7200><s%> [it], for Thou hast beheld <S%H5027><s%> mischief <S%H5999><s%> and vexation <S%H3708><s%> to take <S%H5414><s%> it into Thy hand. <S%H3027><s%> The unfortunate <S%H2489><s%> commits <S%H5800><s%> [himself] to Thee; Thou hast been <S%H1961><s%> the helper <S%H5826><s%> of the orphan. <S%H3490><s%>

Break <S%H7665><s%> the arm <S%H2220><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> and the evildoer, <S%H7451><s%> Seek <S%H1875><s%> out his wickedness <S%H7562><s%> until Thou dost find <S%H4672><s%> none. <S%H1077><s%>
The Lord <S%H3068><s%> is King <S%H4428><s%> forever <S%H5769><s%> and ever; <S%H5703><s%> Nations <S%H1471><s%> have perished from His land. <S%H6><s%>

O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Thou hast heard <S%H8085><s%> the desire <S%H8378><s%> of the humble; <S%H6035><s%> Thou wilt strengthen <S%H3559><s%> their heart, <S%H3820><s%> Thou wilt incline <S%H7181><s%> Thine ear <S%H241><s%>

To vindicate <S%H8199><s%> the orphan <S%H3490><s%> and the oppressed, <S%H1790><s%> That man <S%H582><s%> who is of the earth <S%H776><s%> may cause <S%H6206><s%> terror <S%H6206><s%> no <S%H1077><s%> more. <S%H3254><s%> <S%H5750><s%>
